intro: Polyphragmon stipulosum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved polyphragmon, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance in local ecosystems.
